title: Reporting too much?
body:
I've been that kind of person that reports whenever someone says "ggez" at the end for unsportsmanlike conduct (which I'm starting to think is really just a waste of time at this point).  The problem is I'm not sure if my reports are getting through anymore.

There have been people that 100% deserve to get reported in my games, but, I'm curious as to the instant feedback system not appearing at all.

Basically, I'm curious to know if there's a way to find out if my reports are being ignored for the amount of reports I've sent already.  If they are, well, I don't blame them.  Either way, I'll try to better man here and keep my mouth shut for a while.

replies.body: If you report every game your report 'mojo' decreases. Try reporting less and having fun with the game, just forget that the option is there for like 3 games and when someone says something particularly shitty that's when you report them. You will receive more assists this way. GL and HF man.

That is a problem with the system. The constant stream of asshats acting like children protect the other assholes.

"Oh you reported the last 10 people who were racist to you and threatened to kill your family? Well youre reporting a lot so only the first 5 count. Sorry, others were to lazy or qued up with the racist, so they dont get reported."

System needs work, tribunal had its problems, but still let someone see a pattern of behavior.

Instant feedback only notifies you if your report was the last one triggering a punishment.

If they happen to be banned the game after you reported them, then you won't be notified.

Stop being trigger happy with the report button. Someone saying GGEZ is not worth reporting because that is one of the smallest BM someone can do and doesn't affect your life in the slightest. If you report less your reports mean more.
no one is going to get banned for typing ggez , grow up , the report system is complete shit
